thread.title: GMC’s Quiet Success Backstops Fast-Evolving GM

author: Mike Colias
title: GMC’s Quiet Success Backstops Fast-Evolving GM

organizations.name: gmc’s quiet success backstops fast-evolving gm general motors co.

text:
General Motors Co.’s executives considered axing the GMC truck division ahead of the company’s bankruptcy, as they sought to scale back the sprawling Detroit auto maker. GM’s decision to keep the brand is paying off a decade later as pricey pickups and sport-utility vehicles displace luxury sedans as America’s rolling status symbol.
As Chief Executive Mary Barra pushes forward with her strategy to exit some major markets, including Europe, the relatively unsung GMC unit has become a disproportionate contributor to the company’s... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
